subject: Re: [junit] Re: Require Help on HTML unit
msgSnippet: Marc, Thank you very much i see a meta tag http-refresh. Now i have one more question I am trying to hit the https://production site adn i do not get any
messageBody:
Marc,

Thank you very much i see a meta tag http-refresh.
Now i have one more question I am trying to hit the https://production site adn i do not get any security alert window for the certificate but the error still syas Could nto find trusted certificate.

Code:

package com.bv;

import java.net.URL;

import com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.WebClient;
import com.gargoylesoftware.htmlunit.html.HtmlPage;
public class TestLoginPage{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
try{
WebClient webClient = new WebClient();
URL url = new URL(https://www.-----.org);
HtmlPage page = (HtmlPage)webClient.getPage(url);
System.out.println( "Title :" + page.getTitleText());
System.out.println( "Title :" + page.getWebResponse().getContentAsString());
}catch(Exception e){
System.out.println("Exception: " + e);
}
}
}


Error :

Exception: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: Could not find trusted certificate

Is there someway u could help me out here too There is no refresh on this page

Thanks for your help again

Poornima
Marc Guillemot <mguillemot@...> wrote:
Hi,

the prefered place for htmlunit related questions is the htmlunit-user
mailing list: http://sourceforge.net/mail/?group_id=47038

It seems that your login.html page contains a meta http-refresh tag that
require a refresh to... login.html. To prevent infinite loops that may
be difficult to understand, htmlunit's default RefreshHandler throw
immediately an exception when it sees a refresh on the same page.
If this refresh is normal for your web application, you can set your own
refresh handler on the WebClient using WebClient.setRefreshHandler.

Marc.
